answers.answer: I suggest going to see a specialist called a Reproductive Endocrinology and Infertility specialist because you need a more complete work up for your condition.You must rule out diabetes and cushing syndrome, because of your symptoms of swollen abdomen, frequent urination.I also suggest that you increase you medication Synthroid until the TSH approaches 2.0.This must be done by a specialist like a Reproductive Endocrinologist.
Dear Doctor,So by reading my blood test u say I can PCOS...is that what u mean?Second thing.....u think that I may not b having diabetes or cushing syndrome?

question: Dear Doctor,I am very sad and depressed as i was diagonised with hypothyroid  6 months ago and currently m taking synthriod pills...I think I have PCOS too...m not sure though...but m afraid of asking my husband to take me to a gyno for this as he is sick n tired of my thyroid itself.I got my blood test done 6 months ago ...it says TSH:84 uiu/mlFSH:3.9 miu/mlLH:28.9 miu/mlprolactin:18.5 ng/mlestradiol:177.3 pg/mlDhea sulphate:208 ug/dlfree testosterone:0.06 ng/dlMy latest blood test a month ago said TSH:3.9 uiu/ml...rest test not done nd i dont know....I am 21 , married, no kids....i have a swollom kind of abdomen...luk pregnant....rest body is thin......my menstrual cycle is also irregular........ less sex drive,frequent urine.My question is do i have pcos?or bcos of hypothyroid my other hormones were abnormal  ?
title: PLZ PLZ PLZ HELP ME
